What if your professional adventure started @ Airbus !Are you looking for an internship or for a gap year internship allowing you to validate your diploma this year?We would like to give you the opportunity to work for a world-leading company in its field, focused on digital technology, at the forefront of research and innovation.

We offer an internship: ¬´ Cyber/IT security tool development for vulnerability identification (m/f) ¬ª at Airbus SAS in site location BLAGNAC or ISSY-Les-MOULINEAUX - FRANCEYou will join the "Airbus Corporate Digital Security" department in charge of digital security company wide .Your internship will consist in contributing to the development of software supporting security evaluators identifying vulnerabilities.Ideally, this is a 6 month internship .

It will happen in the cyber security evaluator team, located in Blagnac and Issy-les-Moulineaux.

The team has the mission to :

- operate offensive cyber security testing by reproducing the behavior of skilled, motivated and equipped attackers in order to identify weaknesses and entry points that could be exploited.

- share threat perspective to secure our systems.- provide Digital Security Expertise in order to increase Airbus Security maturity level and support decision-making.

The topic will be defined with the cyber security evaluator team in accordance with your experience, or wishes in term of competence development.

It will certainly adress the following topics:

state of the art of security features offered by CPUs for some key architecture (ex: x86 32 bits),
state of the art of existing kernel security check tools
¬†tool development in itself (from design phase to implementation)
test of the tool on some real targets

You can have an overview of software development from the team browsing : https://github.com/airbus-seclab/ and https://airbus-seclab.github.io

We're looking for the following knowledge:

cyber security background, as well as notions in low level security
master at least 1 programming language (python, rust, etc.) and be ready to learn new ones
reverse engineering knowledge would be a plus
knowledge in mathematics would be a plus for tables/structures recognition

Curiosity, self initiative are key values for this internship.

Titre: Stage BUT Informatique: Data Integration and Deployment Technician
Description_du_poste:
Square Sense integrates IoT data with comprehensive building information to provide an analytical platform that helps real-estate asset managers make informed decisions.

As a member of the Onboarding Team, you will work closely with account managers and IoT engineers to analyze and interpret building and IoT data, integrating it into the Square Sense platform and ensuring its accurate use by end-user applications. Additionally, you will work with data analysts and data engineers to debug and troubleshoot the data processing.

Key Responsibilities:

‚ÄãAnalyze diverse building documentation (e.g., floor plans, rent rolls, IoT installation plans, etc.), convert it into structured formats to be processed by our internal tools.

Configure the software according to the agreed specifications, based on the client‚Äôs needs‚Äã and analyzed documentation.

Test the data processing after configuration to ensure proper functionality.

Provide support after deployment to troubleshoot issues or adjust settings.

Troubleshoot the data processing using the internal tools (may require use of SQL, Python) to identify and resolve issues related to asset metadata or IoT data.

Report issues in data quality or data processing and collaborate with real-estate asset managers, product managers, software developers and external partners to address and resolve them.

üöÄ Join Our Team as a Software Consultant (Apprenticeship)! üöÄ

Looking to kickstart your career and make an impact? We‚Äôre offering an apprenticeship opportunity for a Software Consultant to implement Powell Software solutions tailored to our clients‚Äô needs. If you‚Äôre passionate about technology and customer success, this is the role for you!

üåü Your Key Responsibilities:

Powell Teams Expert: Become an expert in implementing Powell Teams solutions, ensuring smooth technical and functional integrations for our clients.

Customer Support Champion: Provide continuous support to our customers, offering advice and best practices to meet their specific needs.

Trainer: Help our clients understand how our products work and guide them in deploying the tools effectively.

Relationship Builder: Maintain strong relationships with our existing clients, present new features, share the product roadmap, and gather feedback to continuously improve our solutions‚Äîall while reducing customer churn.

Product Team Collaborator: Work closely with our Product team to share customer insights and market trends, directly contributing to our product roadmap.

Problem Solver: Handle minor customer requests efficiently by collaborating with the support team, ensuring client satisfaction.

Strategic Advisor: Guide clients on best business practices and identify opportunities for additional consulting or auditing services.

Client Advocate: Act as the bridge between clients and our technical delivery team, ensuring their needs for evolution are communicated and addressed.

The role

This role is responsible for the upkeep and maintenance of all the IT equipment used across the sites in France whilst also supporting the wider Benelux-France region and European cluster. It will be your direct responsibility to troubleshoot hardware and software issues, support network resources and assist users with their technology-related inquiries.

For this role, fluency in both French and English is essential in order to interact daily with the IT teams in the Benelux and Group headquarters.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What you‚Äôll do
Maintain our office hardware landscape including user devices, office devices and license management.
Be the face of the IT Support team for our DC located in Lisses and provide support to all HelloFresh employees on site.
Provide first level technical support for desktops, laptops, printers, scanners and other IT equipment. Diagnose, troubleshoot and resolve hardware issues promptly and efficiently.
Offer timely and courteous technical assistance to end-users, addressing their queries related to hardware, software and network access. Guide employees through problem-solving steps and escalate complex issues to appropriate teams if necessary.
Assist in the configuration, monitoring and maintenance of the local area network (LAN) to ensure smooth data transmission and connectivity through the distribution center.
Collaborate with the IT Team to perform regular system upgrades and preventive maintenance to ensure security and stability of our IT environment.
Keep Track of IT inventory, including hardware, software licenses, and peripherals. Maintain accurate records and oversee the replacement or repair of defective equipment.
Assist in implementing and maintaining IT security protocols and practices, including data backup, antivirus protection, and access controls, to safeguard sensitive information.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams on various IT-related projects, such as system upgrades, process improvements and technology implementations.
Deploying new hardware, software and accounts to our employees.
Monitor and manage cloud service usage on a global scale.
Manage vendors and service providers onsite for 3rd party work.
Identifying and leading continuous improvement processes.
Communicate with technical service providers (like internet and telephone providers) regarding issues and new projects.
What you‚Äôll bring
Proven experience in IT support or related roles
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with end-users and team members
Solid knowledge of Windows, Mac, Android and iOS Operating systems
A thorough understanding of G-Suite Software, Entra ID (Former Azure), Atlassian and Jamf/Intune
Previous experience with Zebra, Windows and Mac devices
A basic understanding of networking hardware, support and protocols
Ability to multitask and prioritise tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field would be preferred.
IT support experience in a warehouse or distribution center environment would be advantageous but not essential

As part of a team of technical experts and pentesters, you will help ensure the security of IT systems (Headquarters, Hotels, Regional Offices, etc.) by identifying vulnerabilities through penetration testing and then providing concrete corrective solutions for our internal teams.

Your main responsibilities will be:

Checking the security level of applications (penetration testing, code review, audit, etc.). These are primarily Web, Mobile, and API applications.
Proposing effective and pragmatic protective measures, contextualized to the technologies used by the project teams. Supporting projects in considering security.
Developing security tools necessary for the team or ongoing tests.
Training and raising awareness among teams about security issues.
Participating in defining security standards and procedures (secure development guides, best practices, etc.).
Checking the security level of the IS across all IS layers ("Redteaming").
Technology watch, monitoring security alerts.
Given our international context, some travel may be required (about 2 times a year).
Additional Information

Accor dares to impact:¬†

- the world¬†¬†

We are committed to the world around us, with a strong employer culture focused on the development of our 300,000 talents.¬†

On the tech side, we are committed to reducing the impact of digital technology across all our projects.¬†

- your career:¬†¬†

We enable all our employees to manage their work-life balance and offer them the means to shape their work environment according to their preferences.¬†

Training and career paths are defined both individually and collectively, allowing us to grow together on a daily basis.¬†

We value the richness of diverse nationalities represented, from various backgrounds, encompassing all the stories that make us who we are. We encourage diversity in personalities and professional paths. We know how to adapt to the specific needs of our employees, especially those with disabilities.¬†

- Specifically, at Accor Tech¬†¬†

Continuous improvement & training: Hackathons, exceptional technological partnerships, dedicated talent management, and a specialized platform for training, Digitech Academy & certifications.¬†

and also,¬†¬†

Remote work,¬†

Work from Everywhere: Personal access provided to over 500 coworking spaces, many of which are within our hotels.¬†

ALL - Heartist¬Æ Program: Unforgettable stays and experiences at all Accor locations and partner venues worldwide.¬†

Heartist¬Æ for Good Program: Commit to supporting an association of your choice from those available on our volunteering platform (1 day offered per year by the Group during your working hours).¬†

An Employee Social Committee (CSE) supporting the financing of your cultural and sports activities.¬†

Sustainable Mobility Package up to ‚Ç¨700 for the use of "green" transportation, or 75% coverage of Pass Navigo (public transportation pass).¬†

‚Ç¨10 meal vouchers.¬†

A mandatory health insurance plan funded at 50% by Accor without additional costs in case of enrollment of your dependents.¬†

And at our Issy les Moulineaux site: Collaborative workspaces, an employee restaurant, unlimited coffee, gaming and sports areas, a concierge service, and a park just across the street üòâ¬†

Is this mission appealing to you?¬†

Apply, and we will offer you:¬†

A personalized feedback.¬†

Reporting directly to the Head of the Airbus Group Finance Transformation and in dotted line to Airbus Helicopter EVP Finance, you will work with the Finance Management Board of the division to continuously evolve the strategy of the Finance function and drive the implementation of our Vision and Mission in relation with Airbus Group. A strong focus lies on our digital process transformation. You will be directly accountable for the digital ambition for our Finance processes and evolving the organization design to adapt to new ways of working with digital tools.

¬†

The position requires a strong focus on the provisioning of new digital capabilities - in close collaboration with your partners in IM - to continuously improve our levels of efficiency, adapting to new ways of working in the division and preparing for the future. Ensuring a solid digital foundation in all our entities is also part of your mission (ERP standards to ensure financial and compliance standards can be ensured), as well as driving advanced modern reporting and planning solutions. In context of digitalization, you will contribute to or manage all projects which impact financial systems.¬†

You will be contributing to the evolution of the Finance strategy, driving the necessary organization design and digital transformation to shape our Finance function of the future.

Close collaboration with IT, our main country (SP, GE, FR), Customer Centers (worldwide)¬† representatives is mandatory.

Your Role

Using your expertise, you will be responsible to:

Lead a team located in Marignane and Donauworth of finance process and finance systems experts, attract and retain talents (14 positions)

Shape and implement the Transformation strategy to turn the Finance function Vision and mission into reality

Drive Change Management in the function

Act as advisor in our senior leadership team on digital transformation and be the change agent to support in their change journey with their respective organizations

Manage the global Finance project portfolio and related budget for all change and digital matters

Be a partner with other functions to jointly elevate the transformation efforts of the company (e.g. collaboration with the new ERP Program team etc.).

Drive the new SAP S4HANA implementation for Finance in our main countries and Customer Centers and the related BW adaptations.

Cultivate and promote a culture of innovation and continuously adopt best practices and solutions

What you need to make real what matters

Leadership and social competencies

Proficient in English command

Excellent influencing skills to be able to lead in a matrix and drive our Transformation change management efforts across the whole Finance function and teaming up with many other parts of the organization

Work experiences in international environment and business experiences in various regions, ideally in large complex organizations or consulting firms

Knowledge about Finance (Accounting, Controlling, Treasury, Tax), Compliance and Audit Business Processes

In-depth Experience in Digital and ERP/SAP, ideally leading multiple large scale projects of ERP implementations and other related Finance, Supply Chain or Manufacturing systems/digital solutions (Reporting & Planning, applied AI, data-hub, etc.)

Experience in leading Digital teams, managing project-portfolios, running many projects in parallel

Your working environment:

Major economic hub with Marseille-Provence Airport, Marignane is a dynamic city in the south east of France. It is located near the cities of Aix-en-Provence and Marseille.¬†

How we care for you:

Financial rewards: Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis.

Work / Life Balance:¬† Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services.

Wellbeing / Health: Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application.

Individual development: Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects¬† with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility.

This position requires a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities.

Take your career to a new level and apply online now!¬†

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company‚Äôs success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Airbus Helicopters SAS

Employment Type:

Permanent

-------

Haddad Brands Europe, founded 6 years ago, specializes in the distribution of licensed children's apparel (Nike, Levi‚Äôs, Converse, Jordan, Polo Ralph Lauren, Lacoste...) across Europe.

The company has experienced rapid growth since its inception and already has over 500 employees throughout Europe üåç.

We distribute our products both in wholesale, working with major specialized or multi-brand retailers, and in retail, through our in-store corners in department stores.

In concrete terms, this means that if you buy children‚Äôs apparel (ages 0-7 for Nike and 0-16 for Levi‚Äôs, Converse, and Jordan), whether it‚Äôs in-store, online, in France, Romania, or any other European country, the product in your hands has passed through our hands üòäeven if you bought it in a Nike or Levi‚Äôs store!

To support our growth, we are offering a permanent position as a IT DIRECTOR.¬†


YOUR MISSIONS

Your main responsibilities will include

Design and manage the development of information systems architecture for HADDAD's activities in Europe, in line with business needs.
Coordination of information systems projects.
Management of the Information Systems Department: supervision of supplier/service provider contracts, proposal of solutions to meet EDI and picking requirements.
Budget management and monitoring
Define IT and telecoms strategy with General Management.
Define IT security policy: identify sensitive information and risks with General Management, propose measures to be taken.
Monitor technological and legal developments in the Company's information systems sector.
Anticipate changes and guide General Management's choices in terms of information technology.
Design optimal organization of information flows within the company.
Ensure that the needs of the Company and its customers, the Company's strategy and IT tools are in line with each other.

PROFILE SOUGHT :

With a degree in IT, you have significant experience in information systems management and at least 10 years' experience in team and project management.
You have a sound knowledge of Dynamics D365 Finance and Operations, Salesforce, Manhattan, Talend, Cloud Azur (Microsoft).
You also have knowledge of EDI platforms.
Ability to manage service providers in terms of organization and budget monitoring
Ability to transcribe business needs into processes and translate them into IT flows
You are operational and can take a step back to define an IT vision
You have excellent interpersonal skills (oral and written communication) and are able to take the initiative in organizing your day-to-day activities.
Exchanges with Haddad US, our suppliers and foreign customers take place on a daily basis, so a good level of English is a must.

At Dataiku, we're not just adapting to the AI revolution, we're leading it. Since our beginning in Paris in 2013, we've been pioneering the future of AI with a platform that makes data actionable and accessible. With over 1,000 teammates across 25 countries and backed by a renowned set of investors, we're the architects of Everyday AI, enabling data experts and domain experts to work together to build AI into their daily operations, from advanced analytics to Generative AI.

What about Dataiku IT team?

Dataiku‚Äôs IT organization is composed of the IT Operations, IT Support, and Security teams.

Within the IT organization, the IT Operations team is responsible for the:

Applications (50+, including Google Workspace, Slack, Zoom ‚Ä¶)
Devices (fleet composed mainly of MacOS, but also Windows and Linux)
Services
Networks

that enables Dataiku employees to work efficiently.

How you‚Äôll make an impact

Dataiku is looking for a talented IT Operations Manager to join the team. We are looking for an energetic individual with organizational skills, communication skills, and a strong technology background.

You will report to the Senior Manager of IT Ops Engineering, and work closely with the IT (Support, Operations, Security) and Infrastructure teams.

As an IT Operations Manager, your role will be twofold:

actively participate in our daily IT Operations
manage IT projects, both led by IT or by other departments (eg: People, Marketing, Product)

Here's a taste of how you can help the team:

Participate in our daily IT operations (SaaS management, configuration review, automation, escalation point for IT support, share and implement continuous improvement)

Contribute to the improvement of our IT operations (review and standardization of our processes)
Manage projects autonomously - in collaboration with internal stakeholders and vendors
Collect requirements/needs from internal stakeholders
Write specifications and collaborate with technical teams
Lead the project delivery
Participate in the definition and update of our IT roadmap
Collaborate daily with the whole IT department: Support, Security, Infra
Build and maintain relationships with key partners, both within Dataiku and among our suppliers (in collaboration with the Procurement)

Some examples of projects you may manage:

Implementation/Replacement of a SaaS application
Automate SaaS operation to reduce IT manual workload and improve lead time
Preparation for an upcoming audit (in collaboration with the Compliance team)
Coordinate IT work for an office move or major internal/external events

What you need to be successful

Have +3 years of experience working in IT, especially in those fields: Operations, Service Delivery, Project Management
Have a strong interest in and knowledge of corporate IT topics (SaaS, device management, security, etc.)
Appreciate collaborating with various departments and technical teams
Are an organized, resourceful, process-oriented mind, with an ability to work with autonomy
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills (French & English)

Bonus (not mandatory)

You are willing to become an expert on some of our key applications (e.g., Google Workspace, Slack, our ticketing system, etc.)
You like to document and share best practices
You can build reports to track our performances LI-Remote

What are you waiting for!

At Dataiku, you'll be part of a journey to shape the ever-evolving world of AI. We're not just building a product; we're crafting the future of AI. If you're ready to make a significant impact in a company that values innovation, collaboration, and your personal growth, we can't wait to welcome you to Dataiku! And if you‚Äôd like to learn even more about working here, you can visit our Dataiku LinkedIn page.

Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at: reasonable-accommodations@dataiku.com

Unleash Your Potential at L‚ÄôOr√©al‚Äôs Beauty Tech! For more than a century, L‚ÄôOr√©al has devoted itself solely to one business: Beauty. Present in 150 countries across five continents and with ‚Ç¨42 billion consolidated sales, L‚ÄôOr√©al is the global industry leader.Today, L‚ÄôOr√©al includes more than 2,000 tech positions and is constantly growing. Championing Beauty Tech, we invent the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.Beauty Tech is how we know our consumers intimately, augmenting their beauty journeys with unparalleled diverse and sustainable experiences. Beauty Tech equips the Group with the key assets it needs to conquer this new world, where Tech has become strategic. With this ambition, L‚ÄôOr√©al continues to recruit diverse, innovative, skilled and passionate minds in different tech domains such as Data, Digital, Cloud, Cyber Security, IT Architecture, DevOps, Applications and Infrastructure. YOUR FUTURE TEAM    As Contract Manager accountable for the IT services of Global Beauty Tech, you will integrate the Vendor Management Office (VMO) to operate on all activities entrusted to our partners.Under the supervision of the Group VMO Director, you will join an expert‚Äôs community dedicated to all aspects of sourcing management, to partners relation and landscape optimization and Group‚Äôs development strategy support.Infrastructure & application services such as outsourcing processes have no secrets for you, you have actively participated in RFPs and in the implementation of contracts in an international context, you know how to daily manage your contract baseline, you are rigorous, process oriented but flexible and agile? Your focus is Business, and your obsession is to support IT teams?Join us to lead innovative projects and support the transformation of our company!! What a day in the life of the IT Vendor Management Office team looks like:   Among the missions entrusted to you, you will pay a particular attention to the respect of the sourcing strategy.  You will manage the relationship of Global major suppliers at contractual level (More than 15 suppliers identified)  You will of course develop and negotiate contracts with IT managers, supporting them from the definition of needs to the contract stage  As a leader in your domain, we expect you to develop the Contract Management Practice at Group level in strong partnership with your Group and Zone peers.  These are the key to your commitment  Additionally:   Support the sourcing strategy   Support of contract stage in case of supplier massification  Support for the implementation of different sourcing models (onshore/nearshore/offshore),  Support for the transformation of sourcing models (packages, managed services, Business Platforms),  Support for delivery transformation (Agile)   Manage the partnership of major suppliers in the area at the contractual level   Contracts (technical, legal and commercial elements)  Governance (Contractual, Performance)  Performance (Kpi‚Äôs, SLA‚Äôs..)   Ensure the compliance of suppliers in the  contractualization  stages in partnership with :   Legal  Purchasing  Security   Accompany the implementation of the optimization paths identified by the VMO  MassificationOptimization Renegotiations‚Ä¶  Develops and negotiates contracts  with IT managers from the definition of needs and with other support functions (purchasing/security/legal) during the search for a new supplier, extension of a partnership/change   Develops the Contract Management function in the Global Beauty Tech including  Support and coordination with IT teams (definition of needs, supplier relations, governance & escalation process, contract management escalation processes, contract & change management‚Ä¶)Support and coordination of legal/purchasing/security support teams: onboarding of teams during identified projects, communication of the supplier/project strategy‚Ä¶  Ensure compliance with Internal Rules (sourcing model, governance, performance follow up)    THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED!    First and foremost,  we love people that are curious, collaborative, eager to have an impact, proactive and who value innovation, autonomy, and team spirit. Secondly,  in this specific position, it will be important for you to have:  You have at least 5 to 7 years of experience in a similar position, an operational level of English, an appetence for IT, broad knowledge of Beauty Tech and digital markets would be a plus, knowledge of Contract Lifecycle Management tools is recommended.  Cursus in the field of contract management or equivalent graduation / study  General knowledge of information technology (IS/IT)  Knowledge of different delivery models and related sourcing options in IT Services (T&M, FPC, WUB, IMS, AMS, Run, Roll-out, Build ‚Ä¶.)  Understanding of different standards and frameworks in the field of IT services (ITIL, ISO/CEI 20000, , eSCM, Agile methodology & related organization, DevOps model ‚Ä¶.) Ability to synthesize and present to CxO level Listens carefully to clients to understand their needs, to clearly qualify them and find the most appropriate solutions  Takes initiatives in change management & communication to facilitate the implementation of solutions and user satisfaction  Capacity to acquires new IT knowledge quickly and keeps abreast of technological developments and market trends  Rigorous, process minded as well as flexible & agile > ability to adapt to new situation and propose solution eg :  Develop collaborative/cooperative mode of operation  Develop teamwork with participants from different industries, countries and cultures  Ability to achieve common goals  Manage effective interactions with internal and external contributors to find the support needed for success  From a business standpoint:  Assimilates the company‚Äôs overall business strategy and understands the long-term needs of users/customers  Ability to translate them into IT strategy  High level understanding of portfolio project management  Advanced usage on common and standard tooling related to workplace (Office, Teams, Visio conferencing, share, ‚Ä¶.) A vacancy has arisen for a Certification Specialist within ATR Certification Department in Toulouse.

Your main mission will be to support the preparation of the certification strategy for the ATR design modifications and new project ATR EVO with the Primary Certification Authority (EASA) and Foreign Authorities in order to ensure the compliance of the ATR products to the applicable regulations.

This position will be an opportunity for you to:

Develop or enhance your multi-ATA knowledge (overall ATR aircraft, propulsion, systems architecture, operational characteristics and related documentation)
Enhance your influence & negotiation skills supporting a team of certification specialists that are in direct contact with the EASA and other foreign authorities (FAA, TCCA, ANAC, etc.)
Strengthen your technical and soft skills
Join a group with a strong team spirit and collaborative mindset
Join a diverse and multicultural entity

ACTIVITIES

As Certification Specialist, you will:

Work in a transversal role among the different ATR design departments involved in the certification of a modification and/or new project
Work in coordination with the ATR technical specialists from the preparation to the final certification (according to EASA Part 21)
Within this perimeter you will support:
The classification of the modifications according to EASA Part 21 para.21.A.91
The establishment of the certification basis, associated means of compliance and identification of any risk conjointly with the technical specialists
The negotiation and agreement with the authorities of the means of compliance applicable to the established certification basis and their associated level of involvement, according to the EASA Part21
The organization of any necessary contact and meeting with the authorities and ATR technical specialists
The management of the certification activities, until the approval of the modification, following the plan agreed with EASA, or with the foreign authorities (FAA, TCCA, ANAC, etc.)
The preparation of the modification approval document to be signed by the Head of the Office of Airworthiness or his delegates
In addition, if required, you will:
Prepare the Definition Notes of the aircraft to be delivered, ensuring consistency between the aircraft definition, the list of Type Certificate modifications (standard and optional)
Support the regulatory watch activity evaluating the impact on ATR products of any new European and foreign regulation
Support the identification of the differences between the certification guidance (AMC, AC, etc.) of the authorities
Develop presentations to support working groups with manufacturers and/or the aeronautical authorities

PROFILE

Master degree (or equivalent) in Engineering
Appreciable knowledge of certification of large airplanes (EASA CS 25 and foreign regulations, FAA, TCCA, ANAC, etc.)
Basic knowledge of Part 21 (Type Certification, Changes to the Type Certificate and Repairs) and DOA rules (Subpart J)
Experience in aviation, with general notions of systems, structures, cabin and flight physics. Specific experience in certification of propulsion systems and its interfaces would be appreciated.
Knowledge of hybrid propulsion systems is a plus
Ability to manage, follow up and present the status of the activities
Very good team spirit mindset
Good oral and written communication skills and leadership
The knowledge of the ATR products is a plus
Negotiation level (advanced) in English and French
Italian is a plus

Special constraints related to the position (special hours, travel, laptop): Hourly flexibility according to the certification needs.

A vacancy for A400M Global Support Material Support Service Representative (MSSR) has arisen within Airbus Defence and Space located at French Air Force A400M Main Operating Base in Orleans (France). The successful applicant will join TASMA-TL1 department.

In the frame of Airbus A400M Global Support (PBL contract including Spain, France, BELUX and UK fleets):

A. The MSSR is the central focal point for all matters related to Material Support Services at the customer‚Äôs site. As such, the MSSR should always be in the position to provide the highest possible level of Services and respond to and solve (when possible) all the customer¬¥s requirements and needs related to Material Support. The MSSR is integrated in the Airbus Support Centre

B. The MSSR ensures that the contractual material performance related to maintenance services is achieved, locally at the Main Operating Base, by the MRO and in deployments off-MOB.

C. The MSSR is responsible for the surveillance of the materials needed to guarantee the fleet and material availability, anticipate the spares needed and inform both, the customer and the Support Centre.

D. The MSSR will be responsible to manage all operational activities related to Repairs, Spares, Transportation, Warehousing, Quality and Export Control.

E. The MSSR will align with the other MSSRs at the different Global Support customers locations in order to fulfil the global requirements.

F. The MSSR will support the delivery/reception of IPLs.

G. The MSSR will support customer material requests for other contracts: AGEs, CA60, Maturity, Fleet Support, Retrofit,...

Task & accountabilities:A. The jobholder supports the delivery of Spares Availability Service for In Service Support contracts with customers, as per advanced context of Performance Based Logistics programs and in line with the contractual requirements budget constraints of each contract in place.

B. The jobholder delivers results as part of an organisation within ADS Customer Services, that provides the solution of the spares availability and the inventory optimisation services.

C. The Jobholder contributes to the Customers‚Äô fleet availability and support the contract manager to ensures profit is achieved for the Company, instead of penalties due to material unavailability as associated to each contract.

D. The jobholder ensures the minimisation of discrepancies, anticipation of spare needed, avoidance of AOG transportation and any daily operative issue that improve the fleet operation.

E. The jobholder must increase and maintain the customer satisfaction.

F. The jobholder will work according to the Services Program Directive, guarantying relevant stakeholders buy-in in the development of the support service customised solutions.

G. The jobholder ensures Material Support deliverables to Customer On Quality, On Time, On Cost, working closely with internal areas and local Subsidiary.

H. The jobholder will contribute to the Reports on Material Services for the follow-up meetings with internal and external Customers (monthly Program Review Meeting, monthly meeting with OCCAR/Customer/Program Office, monthly Financial meeting and other internal regular ones) to provide visibility on Material Services performance per Contract.

Required skills :Master degree in business administration, engineering or equivalentBetween 3 and 5 years of experience in activities which have allowed you to acquire skills and knowledge of:- Material Services- Supply Chain- Project management- Data managementEnglish: AdvancedFrench: Advanced

Job Description:

Airbus Helicopters is looking for a Maintenance Information System Delivery Manager (M/F) to join our Connected Services department based in Marignane, France.

As part of the military project team dedicated to the State customers in France and worldwide (mainly Ministries of Defence and Ministries of Interior), you will be responsible - from the bidding stage to the contract stage - for implementing a Maintenance Information System in customers IT infrastructures.

Other activities related to the implementation of the full range of Connected Services could be added to this position.

Your working environment:

Major economic hub with Marseille-Provence Airport, Marignane is a dynamic city in the southeast of France. It is located near the cities of Aix-en-Provence and Marseille, which host a rich cultural and tourist offer. Close to the beaches of the C√¥te Bleue, it offers many options for water sports activities.

How we care for you:

- Financial rewards: Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis.

- Work / Life Balance:¬† Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services.

- Wellbeing / Health: Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application.

- Individual development: Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects¬† with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility.

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly.¬†Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Your challenges:

At the bidding stage, you will have to:

- Analyze the customer needs and provide the bidding team with the technical and financial offer related to the implementation of the Maintenance Information System,

- Support the sales manager in front of the customer when necessary.

At the contract stage, you will have to:

- Act as the focal point of both internal (Airbus teams) and external (customers, subcontractors) stakeholders, for all activities related to the implementation of the Maintenance Information System,

- Perform these activities or coordinate their completion by the internal and external technical specialists,

- Achieve project objectives (on quality, on time, on cost) and ensure customer satisfaction in compliance with internal and external rules and regulations,

- Ensure effective integration of lessons learnt.

This role will involve some travels for business worldwide and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.

Your profile:

- Minimum 10 years of professional experience in the field of Maintenance Information System, with a strong technical knowledge (use and/or deployment of maintenance software),

- Fluent in French and English (negotiation level),

- A good knowledge of aeronautical industry and/or military environments is an advantage.

This position requires a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities.

Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions.

Take your career to a new level and apply online now!

At AXA IM our purpose, to act for human progress by investing for what matters, is central to every action we take as a business. As a responsible asset manager, we actively invest for the long-term to help our clients, our people and the world to prosper.

As a future ITSCM Officer you will report to our Head of Cybersecurity Operation and you will be part of AXA IM Technology - Infrastructure team.

Cybersecurity Operation team provides expertise to stakeholders to leverage a risk-driven approach and support critical and vital activities for both projects and business-as-usual activities.

In this context, the IT Service Continuity Management Officer plays a crucial role in ensuring the organization's IT services remain operational in the face of potential disruptions, particularly in a complex cybersecurity context.¬†

The primary objective of this role is to strengthen the ITSCM team and the structure in place to develop and implement robust continuity plans to mitigate the impact of ransomware-type threats, ensuring the organization can respond effectively and maintain essential services.

DISCOVER your opportunity

1- IT service continuity Officer (Primary mission)

Develop and maintain IT service continuity plans, ensuring they align with cybersecurity best practices and regulatory requirements.
Maintain documentation and reporting on the status of IT service continuity plans, including lessons learned and continuous improvement initiatives.
Coordinate and conduct recovery exercises, in accord with your published annual exercise schedule to test the effectiveness of continuity plans and improve response capabilities.
Liaise with Technical Architects and Service Delivery Managers, for the review of documentation.
Obtain service recovery assurance from third party Service Providers assuring compliance in alignment with contracted obligations.¬†
Act as a focal point for recovery incident response and support the IT team in implementing recovery measures.
Work closely with the Operational resilience team, in the overall management of IT and business risks.
Maintain the IT Service Continuity Management (ITSCM) Process and Plan
Produce regular reports, and chair relevant meetings with suppliers and stakeholders.
Ensuring the IT resilience capability of the organization, aligns to Business Resilience requirements.
Assure and where appropriate, participate in end-to-end testing for Business Service Continuity exercises.
Contribute to enhancing and optimizing the efficiency of control activities by working hand-in-hand with all concerned stakeholders.

¬†

¬†As part of cybersecurity operation team:

¬†2- Security

Follow company guidelines / regulations to ensure company data is held in a secure manner, including electronic access or in written format.
Escalate any security issues or potential security breaches as appropriate to ensure any potential issues can be secured.
Aligned with Information System Security policy and guidelines, develop and deploy processes that will ensure level 1 controls are in place, actioned and tracked.
Stay abreast of emerging cybersecurity threats and contribute to the development of proactive measures to enhance the organization's resilience against ransomware attacks.
Support IT audits as required and drive the recovery of any audit deficiencies to pre-agreed deadlines.

3- Innovation

Develop a culture of innovation across the team, to deploy new services in a ‚Äúvalue-add‚Äù and cost-effective way towards the business.

Titre: Professional Services Technical Consultant (Alternance/Work Study Trainee)
Description_du_poste:
Hivebrite is an all-in-one community management and engagement platform. Our mission is to provide organizations with the tools they need to create impactful communities.¬†

Our SaaS platform serves customers across a variety of industries including higher education, non-profit, and corporate. Founded in 2015, today we count more than 900 customers worldwide - including Boeing, the Obama Foundation, the National Academy of Sciences, the University of Notre Dame, the U.S. Naval Academy, the British Heart Foundation, the Imperial College London, the P&G Alumni France, and Le Wagon Alumni.¬†

We employ over 170 people across our entities in Paris, New York, the UK, and Sydney, and 30+ nationalities are represented in our team! üåç

At Hivebrite, we believe in the importance of balancing your work commitments and personal life. You‚Äôre able to have a real impact on meaningful communities while prioritizing your personal life and goals. Our work policy encourages a healthy work-life harmony with a flexible schedule.

We also have many initiatives to keep our global team connected, offering opportunities to meet and socialize with team members virtually and in-person! üëã

For these reasons, we were awarded Best Hybrid Place to Work by BuiltIn in the US and Choose My Company and HappyIndex at Work in France last year! üèÜ

Jump aboard, and join the hive! üöÄ

üåüYOUR ROLE WILL BE :

In this Work-Study Trainee role, you will join the Professional Services Team at Hivebrite, and your responsibility will be to support the delivery of the technical services from our Service Catalog.

We are seeking a motivated Work/Study trainee, based in Paris, with technically-savvy and interested in the Saas Tech industry skills.

Within the Professional Services team, the primary mission of the Technical Consultant will be to execute technical tasks supporting our services to our clients.

üåü YOUR MISSION WILL BE

Services for client onboardings:

When new customers are subscribing to Hivebrite, an Onboarding Specialist is onboarding the customer. As part of your mission, you‚Äôll help to:

- Create and configure the customer‚Äôs platform within Hivebrite

- Build out the platform with the content, assets and information provided by the customer

- Configure the mobile application for the client within the Apple Store and the Google Store

- Deliver any other technical task that could support the onboarding of a new customer

- Build training content to digitalize the training within onboarding

- Document processes and specifications for customer onboarding

- Collaborate with support teams to create or update knowledge base articles, FAQs, and video tutorials for onboarding

Services for Data migrations and import:

Our data migration services involve extracting data, cleaning data, analyzing data, reviewing data with the customer and importing data. As part of your role, you will:

- Get data using APIs

- Clean and analyze data using spreadsheets

- Import data

- Document processes and specifications for data services

- Create technical process documentation for internal usage

Support for Data Analytics:

As part of our data analytics services, you may be required to:¬†

- Build custom reports in our in-house Analytics module

- Document custom reports for our clients

- Analyze custom reports for our clients

- Document processes and specifications for analytics services

- Track and report on onboarding success metrics such as time-to-first-value

Hivebrite offers a variety of services, so you may be involved in those ones, allowing you to work on a large scale of types of Saas platform services.

üåüYOU MIGHT BE A FIT IF YOU HAVE:

Currently study for a Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Technically savvy:

- Expert in spreadsheet manipulation

- Knowledge in data analysis

Fluent in English
Strong understanding of software development methodologies and best practices
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with clients
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to develop creative solutions to complex problems
Excellent organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality work

üåü RECRUITMENT PROCESS

A 45 min video call with Max, our Talent Acquisition Manager
A 1 hour video-call with Paloma, our Manager of the EU Onboarding Team, and your potential futur manager to go deeper on the job description and for you to understand the expectations of the role.
A 30 minutes visio call with Matt (Head of Professional Services)
A last meeting within our office, to meet the rest of the team

üöÄOur recruitment process lasts max 15 working days and we can deliver an offer 48 hours after the final interview

üåüHIVEBRITE'S PERKS & BENEFITS:

Office life:¬†

- International team - you will easily hear 3 different languages in the same conversation üåç

- Morning's office in the center of Paris with a rooftop just for us!¬†

- Pool üé±, foosball ‚öΩÔ∏è, and a gym room üèãÔ∏è

- Squads days for our engineering team - two days per month we meet at the office üí°

- Team building with dedicated budget for events every month with your team and yearly with your entire department¬†üéâ

- Check out our instagram page here to discover our team and this page, to know more about us¬† üì∑

- Your Employee Journey detailed here¬†üçÉ

Work-Life balance:¬†

- A Gymlib access for you to practice any physical activity you want üí™

On the financial side:¬†

- Of course, all the mandatory benefits, but with the best companies to support you (Alan, lunch vouchers with Swile, etc.)¬†

- CSE advantages with Swile üéÅ

- A competitive salary package - we constantly ensure that we're aligned with the market¬† ü§ù

- The latest Apple‚Äôs equipment üçè

Are you ready to be at the forefront of manufacturing transformation? Do you want to work with cutting-edge technology and make a real difference? If so, Pelico is the place for you. Join us and be a part of a pioneering journey that is reshaping the future of manufacturing.


About Pelico

At Pelico, we are trailblazers in transforming factory operations by tackling supply chain disruptions head-on. Our mission is to elevate manufacturing intelligence in an era where resource optimization is paramount. In a world where factory disruptions occur every 16 minutes, and countless variables and stakeholders must be synchronized, we provide a powerful solution to unprecedented factory complexity.

Why Pelico?

Innovative Leadership: As the premier leader in supply chain disruption management, we redefine how factories operate, bringing unmatched agility and resilience to factories.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Our state-of-the-art SaaS Supply Chain Operations platform empowers factory teams to swiftly respond to disruptions, ensuring minimal impact and maximum efficiency.
Global Impact: Since our inception in 2019, we‚Äôve partnered with industry leaders across aerospace, industrial equipment, and luxury watchmaking, revolutionizing factory operations in over 15 countries. Esteemed clients include Airbus, Safran, Cartier, Daikin, and Eaton.




Our Team

With a dynamic team of over 100 professionals across the US and France, Pelico is a melting pot of top-tier talent from Tech, Data Science, and Manufacturing domains. Our collaborative environment fosters innovation and excellence, driving us to solve complex challenges and shape the future of manufacturing. Besides the satisfaction that we bring our customers every day, our work has been recognised by Safran (Digital Transformation Award) and Microsoft (scale-up of the year).

As an Application and Technical Support Engineer at Therapanacea, you will be at the heart of our customer relationships. Your core responsibility will be to handle customer support by providing timely and effective responses, guiding clients through installations, and ensuring comprehensive post-installation support for our clinical products.

Key Responsibilities

Customer Support:

Receive, analyze, and resolve customer technical requests to ensure satisfaction.

Act as a key player in incident resolution in collaboration with technical teams.

Maintain a proactive nurturing of clients to respond to their needs and enhance their user experience.

Manage software upgrades, gather customer feedback, and contribute to post-market surveillance activities.

Pre-sales Support

Participate in congresses, organize product demonstrations and trials to showcase the Therapanacea clinical product portfolio.

Be prepared to present the full range of our product features and benefits.

Installation and Training

Organize and conduct software installations, acceptance testing with customers, and training sessions.

Therapanacea internal activities & Project Management:

Contribute to creating and updating customer-facing documentation, internal support processes, and marketing materials.

Coordinate patch releases: define patch scope, track progress with development teams, and oversee testing and deployment phases.

Due to your customer-facing role, you will play a crucial part in bug resolution and enhancement suggestions in close collaboration with the functional team.

You will be based in central Paris, in a vibrant and international setting, working closely with oncology medical teams, AI experts (statistical and deep learning, numerical optimization), and 3D medical image visualization specialists.

This position necessitates the ability to travel locally and internationally, up to 10% of the time.

About

As a Technical Support Manager Intern at Connecting Food, you will be a key player in enhancing our technical support operations and ensuring a smooth utilisation and implementation of our SaaS solution. Reporting to the tech department, you will work closely with customers and internal teams to provide technical assistance, guide through the setup process, and collaborate with various teams to ensure a high-quality customer experience. This internship offers a unique opportunity to develop your technical and customer support skills in a dynamic and innovative environment.

Beyond your day-to-day responsibilities, this internship provides a unique opportunity for you to directly contribute to the company‚Äôs growth and offers a path to success in the technical realm. Your work will help ensure that our clients receive top-notch support and that our testing and communications processes are continuously optimized. This internship serves as a stepping stone towards a potential future in the tech department, providing you with the chance to learn from experienced professionals and gain valuable skills.

Responsibilities

Technical Assistance & Ticket Resolution: Provide pre & post launch technical support to external and internal clients, ensuring they have the necessary assistance to successfully implement our SaaS solution. Actively participate in resolving support tickets.

First Point of Contact: Act as the first point of contact for users, addressing their queries, resolving incidents, and providing necessary training.

Client Onboarding: Support clients throughout the setup and implementation process, ensuring they can effectively use our platform.

Operations and Marketing Support: Assist the customer success and sales teams in their interactions with clients by providing technical support.

Issue Detection & Testing: Collaborate with technical teams to monitor and ensure the reliability of the platform, providing support in technical and functional testing of products. Identify and anticipate potential friction points to prevent customer churn and ensure a smooth user experience.

Feedback Integration: Participate in product development by communicating user feedback and experience to the product team.

Process & Tooling Improvement: Contribute to the ongoing improvement and industrialization of team processes, enhancing overall efficiency.

Product and Tech Team Collaboration: Work closely with product and tech teams to work within Agile & Scrum development processes to resolve technical issues & simplify the SaaS setup process, enhancing client experience.

Activity Reporting: Maintain precise and reliable reporting of support activities and client interactions through current tools (Confluence/JIRA, etc..)

In addition to the core responsibilities, you will concretely engaging in the following tasks:

Support Board Management: Take control of managing the Support board, ensuring timely and efficient handling of support tickets.

QA Support: Assist in functional QA testing to ensure new features and updates meet quality standards, helping to create and refine the QA process.

Communication Excellence: Translate technical issues and solutions into understandable summaries for non-technical stakeholders.

Defect Reporting and Management: Report and record defects and bugs, prioritize their severity, and ensure resolution.

User Support and Training: Serve as the first point of contact for users, addressing their queries, resolving issues, and providing necessary training.
